Package Game.Board

Class Square

  • java.lang.Object
    • Game.Board.Square
  • public class Square
extends java.lang.Object
    Class responsible for creating the squares, four of which are required to create a board.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Square()
      Creates a square of grid 3x3 (array of length 9) and fills it with EMPTY() spots.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      int getIndex​(Coordinates coordinates)
      Method to determine the index of the current square, with the use of X,Y coordinates.
      Spot getSquareSpot​(Coordinates coordinates)
      Method that retrieves a Spot with the use of x,y coordinates.
      void rotateSquare​(Rotation rotation)
      Method for rotating (transposing) the 3x3 square.
      void setSquareSpot​(Spot spot, Coordinates coordinates)
      Setter method for position with the use of x,y coordinates.
      Square squareCopy()
      Creates a copy of a square that can be used for potential manipulations.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Square

        public Square()
        Creates a square of grid 3x3 (array of length 9) and fills it with EMPTY() spots.

    • Method Detail

      • getSquareSpot

        public Spot getSquareSpot​(Coordinates coordinates)
        Method that retrieves a Spot with the use of x,y coordinates.
        Parameters:
        coordinates - x,y pair
        Returns:
        position returned from the board
        Requires
        coordinates != null
        Ensures
        position == Spot.EMPTY || position == Spot.WHITE || position == Spot.BLACK, position != null

      • setSquareSpot

        public void setSquareSpot​(Spot spot,
                          Coordinates coordinates)
        Setter method for position with the use of x,y coordinates. Sets the specified spot on specified coordinates
        Parameters:
        coordinates - x,y pair
        spot - value on the board, can be: EMPTY(), WHITE(W), BLACK(B)
        Requires
        coordinates != null, spot != null

      • rotateSquare

        public void rotateSquare​(Rotation rotation)
        Method for rotating (transposing) the 3x3 square. If a rotation is CLOCKWISE, the grid is going to get transposed to the right If a rotation is COUNTERCLOCKWISE, the grid is going the get transposed to te left
        Parameters:
        rotation - COUNTERCLOCKWISE or CLOCKWISE
        Requires
        rotation != null, rotation.equals(Rotation.COUNTERCLOCKWISE) || rotation.equals(Rotation.CLOCKWISE)

      • squareCopy

        public Square squareCopy()
        Creates a copy of a square that can be used for potential manipulations. E.g. translation during rotation
        Returns:
        copy of the square
        Ensures
        Square != null, copy[] == Spot.EMPTY || Spot.WHITE || Spot.BLACK

      • getIndex

        public int getIndex​(Coordinates coordinates)
        Method to determine the index of the current square, with the use of X,Y coordinates.
        Parameters:
        coordinates - x,y pair
        Returns:
        index of the square derived from provided coordinates
        Requires
        coordinates != null
        Ensures
        index >= 0, index <= 8
